propitious: Favorable, giving good signs for the future, likely to work out; kind or forgiving
proxy: Agent, substitute, person authorized to act on behalf of another
propitiate: Attempt to reconcile with, satisfy, or reduce the animosity of (a person who is angry, offended, etc.)
providential: Lucky, fortunate, or relating to divine care (the idea that a deity has helped or cared for a person)
